title: flatpak version 115 does not recognise my existing profile
content: I have been using v102 for some time now, but decided to migrate to v115. I decided to install the flatpak version, as I don't like appimages, and that is what the standard version appeared to be. It seems there's no deb or rpm versino any more. But when I started it it did not open my existing profile, but instead offered to create a new profile. I started it with the "-P" option, and my existing profile was not displayed on the list. I tried everything I could think of but I could not get TB to open my profile. So I installed the appimage version, and it worked fine. It didn't immediately recognise my profile so I had to start it with the "-p" option but my profile was in the list, and from then on every time I started TB it started with my profile. So why doesn't the flatpak version find my profile? Is there something I've missed? All advice gratefully received.
creator: mogplus8

title: Some (not all) sent mails being duplicated in Sent folder
content:
I use Thunderbird - currently v115.1 x64 on Windows - as the client for my Protonmail account. Lately (like the past couple of weeks) I notice that some - not all - of the mails I send are duplicated in the sent folder. If I check with the recipients, they have only received a single mail. What could cause this intermittent duplication? As an example, here's a screenshot of the last ten or so sent mails. Two are duplicated and the rest not.

I never noticed this problem before upgrading from TB 102 to TB115.
creator: njhp94

title: Calendar: CalDAV: recv: No session found via bearer token
content:
I have multiple CalDav calendars, hosted with Fastmail and authenticated by the same oauth2 account.

Since updating to Thunderbird Supernova from v102, syncing these calendars has become intermittent. Calendar A will behave as normal, but calendar B will disable. On a relaunch of Thunderbird, calendar B may work, but calendar A will now be broken.

The error reported in the log is: -

Calendar: CalDAV: recv: No session found via bearer token

The calendar(s) that trigger this error appear random among the set of 4.

I have tried deleting the oauth2 entry in *saved passwords* and re-entering it and removing the calendars and re-adding them, but the behaviour remains the same. Some calendars work, others not, seemingly at random.
creator: robin84

title: Timestamp-format when forwarding an email
content:
Hi, the following issue is pretty version independent. Happens as well in the 102.x as the new 115.x branch:

i have noticed, that every time I get an e-mail from outside my timezone, which is UTC+2, and I then want to forward this e-mail, the format of the forwarded date-header is different from what the timestamp is in my inbox. For example: I receive an e-mail on Thu, 24th May, 2012 at 17.57 (this is what is the timestamp in my inbox). I forward that e-mail, the date-header is Thu, 24 May 2012 08:57:20 -0700.

Well, UTC+2 and UTC-7 means 9 hours time shift. This is plausible, the person, which sent me that mail has his office somewhere in SFBA, so he will probably have started his day at around 8am and not long after have replied to me. So for me, the date-header in the forwarded message is valid, and the origin time of sender plausible.

How ever, I'd rather have also in the forwarded mail the translated local time then the origin-sender time + Timeshift. Not everybody can, want or has time to calculate timezones... So this is my question: Can I parametrize thunderbird, so that it displays the date-header in the localtime format so that it matches the one from my inbox?

Thank for your help, regards, Felix
creator: felix.joussein

title: Thunderbird Supernova UI fonts/colors
content:
Hi, what are the CSS selectors necessary to update the folder list and the list of emails in Supernova 115.1.0+? Following tips from other support posts don't seem to work:

Thank you.

``` /* successfully changes menu bar, email from,subject,date,etc. */

  • {

font-size: 11pt !important; font-weight: 500 !important; font-family: 'Acari Sans' !important; color: red; !important; }

/* Folder Pane font -- HAS NO EFFECT */

  1. folderTree > treechildren { 
 font-size: 16pt !important;  font-family: 'Acari Sans', 'Segoe UI Variable' !important;  color: yellow !important;

}

/* Threads Pane font -- HAS NO EFFECT */

  1. threadTree > treechildren { 
 font-size: 16pt !important;  font-family: 'Asap Condensed' !important;  color: red !important;

}

/* -- HAS NO EFFECT */ .tree-rows { 

font-size: 14px !important; color: red !important;

} ```

title: See all correspondents in Sent folder messages when using a cc list using Reply All
content:
I "Reply all" to a message. In the Reply All, one person is named on the To: list, and several people are copied on the Cc: list. I send the message to everyone. Everyone receives my reply. So far, so good.

When I view the Sent Mail folder, the Correspondents column only shows the person who was on the To: list. No one Cc:'ed is also shown under Correspondents. However, I want to see everyone who received this message with Reply All in my list of Sent messages. Neither Correspondents or Recipients does this. Is there a way to force a folder to show all the recipients whether on the To: or Cc: list?

Thx in advance, Lysis_romulus
creator: lysis_romulus

title: Thunderbird (v. 115.1.0) for Mac (running Ventura 13.5) won't send or download email from Earthlink/Mindspring Webmail
content:
Thunderbird (v. 115.1.0) for Mac (running Ventura 13.5) won't send email from Earthlink/Mindspring Webmail. Email from Earthlink Webmail only downloads intermittently.

The problem seems to be with my outgoing server settings (see attached). No matter what 'authentication' method I choose - including 'None' - email will not send.

I expect the issue may be that my email domain (@mindspring.com) is from an older provider that is now being served by Earthlink - and the certificates seem to be an issue.

I've been working on this for several days and haven't made any progress. I'd appreciate any suggestion, but don't want to spend a great deal more time.

If anyone has a ‘simple’ solution, I’d love to hear it. Thanks.
creator: ghardy39

title: Default profile not visible on monitor, but other two profiles are
content:
Running Thunderbird Ver. 102.14.0 (32-bit). Have used TB for 25 years.

Running on an HP Desktop (mini-tower) PC running Windows 10, fully updated per last Microsoft update

The Default Profile (which I have renamed "Personal") worked fine after starting PC that morning. Later that day, with TB continuing to run, the Inbox and other folders disappeared fromn the screen.

I have two other profiles that open fine and work normally, but the Personal profile does not. Below are the details.

TB was still showin on the Task Bar, but nothing was visible on the viewing part of the monitor screen. The icon on the Task Bar was unresponsive to left and center clicks, but a right click popped up a list of several .jpg files. When I clicked on any one of those files, an empty "Create" email box opened, ready for composing. But frame showing existing Inbox and other folders did not launch.

Shutting down TB and reopening the same profile momentarily showing the words "Inbox", then shows "Address Book." As I am writing this now, I see "Address Book - Mozill..." on the Task Bar, but clicking on it does not take me there.

When navigating using Alt-Tab to rotate through the open programs, when I get to "Address Book," I can see a thumbnail of the address book, but it will not open when I try to stop there.

I found the three folders containing each profile's files. Comparing the three, all files seem to be present.

I need help badly, because this Personal profile has 99% of all my emails in it from four email addresses.

Thank you. Charles Wolf New York, NY [removed email and phone#'s from public support forum] P.S. I am picking up new emails directly from my provider (Network Solutions)
creator: charles16
